  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Manager, Provider Relations",
  "description": "Reliance Health uses Technology to Make Healthcare Accessible and Affordable. Through an integrated approach that includes affordable health insurance, telemedicine, and a combination of partner and proprietary healthcare facilities, Reliance Health offers innovative healthcare solutions that meet the needs of emerging markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Manager, Provider Relations

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria (Remote)
Job type: Full-time
Category:&nbsp;Clinical Services

About the Role


	We are currently hiring a Manager, Provider Relations role to lead and streamline our provider network operations across different markets.
	The goal is to build a consistent and efficient approach to managing providers, ensuring smooth processes and strong relationships in both current and new markets.


Responsibilities
As the Manager, Provider Relations, you will do the following:


	Develop and implement processes that delight providers on our network as measured by feedback surveys.
	Harmonize provider relationship management process across all markets to similarly address the provider journey map, address bottlenecks and alleviate pain points while adapting and ensuring compliance with local regulations.
	Leverage data and analytics to monitor provider performance, identify emerging trends and risks, and inform continuous improvements to relationship management strategies.
	Develop and implement a strategy to measure and improve the Reliance Health member experience while seeking care at providers on the Reliance Health network across all markets.
	Develop and implement incentives for providers to minimize wait and maximize medical quality for Reliance Health members.
	Collaborate closely with Claims, Tariffs, and Case Management teams to ensure provider-facing processes are aligned, responsive, and support efficient claims processing, cost control, and high-quality care delivery.
	Lead and manage the provider acquisition and relationship management team to drive high performance across assigned portfolios, using data to track and improve clinical quality, member satisfaction, and adherence to Reliance Health processes and standards across all markets.
	Ensure timely and effective resolution of internal and external escalations related to provider issues, leveraging root cause analysis to prevent recurrence and improve provider touchpoints.
	Strengthen provider onboarding and engagement processes to build consistent alignment with operational expectations, reducing instances of long wait times, denied care, and poor member experiences.
	Use performance dashboards and data insights to set clear targets, monitor outcomes, and continuously coach the team to optimize provider compliance, responsiveness, and patient-centered service delivery.


Requirements


	At least 7 years of experience in healthcare operations, provider network management, or a related field.
	Proven track record of leading multi-market operations or managing stakeholders across multiple African countries.
	Experience in building and scaling systems, tools, or teams in a process-oriented environment.
	Strong understanding of the Nigerian healthcare landscape, with relevant contacts or working experience.
	Experience working in or with private healthcare providers, HMOs, or health tech companies is a strong plus.
	Strong negotiation and relationship management skills, especially with healthcare providers or partners.
	Candidate must be based in Nigeria; the role is remote within Nigeria.


Benefits
At Reliance Health, we prioritize our people and their well-being. Our benefits package is designed to support your success, growth, and happiness. Here&rsquo;s what you&rsquo;ll enjoy:


	Remote-First Environment:&nbsp;Work from anywhere while staying connected to a vibrant, collaborative team.
	Competitive Salary and Benefits:&nbsp;We offer a salary that&rsquo;s benchmarked against the best in the industry, ensuring your expertise and impact are fully rewarded.
	Premium Health Insurance:&nbsp;Comprehensive health coverage for you and your family, because your well-being comes first.
	Unlimited Leave:&nbsp;Take the time you need when you need it&mdash;no limits, no questions.
	Meaningful Impact:&nbsp;Play a key role in transforming customer experiences and shaping healthcare innovation.
	Collaborative Work Culture:&nbsp;Join a supportive, inclusive, and team-focused environment that celebrates diversity.
	Growth Opportunities:&nbsp;Access tools, mentorship, and resources to elevate your skills and career.
	Learning &amp; Development Allowance:&nbsp;We provide an allowance to support your ongoing professional growth and skill enhancement.

Manager, Provider Relations Job at Reliance Health




        
    

        
        Reliance Health uses Technology to Make Healthcare Accessible and Affordable. Through an integrated approach that includes affordable health insurance, telemedicine, and a combination of partner and proprietary healthcare facilities, Reliance Health offers innovative healthcare solutions that meet the needs of emerging markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Manager, Provider Relations

Job Location: Nigeria (Remote)
Job type: Full-time
Category: Clinical Services

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are currently hiring a Manager, Provider Relations role to lead and streamline our provider network operations across different markets.
	The goal is to build a consistent and efficient approach to managing providers, ensuring smooth processes and strong relationships in both current and new markets.


Responsibilities
As the Manager, Provider Relations, you will do the following:


	Develop and implement processes that delight providers on our network as measured by feedback surveys.
	Harmonize provider relationship management process across all markets to similarly address the provider journey map, address bottlenecks and alleviate pain points while adapting and ensuring compliance with local regulations.
	Leverage data and analytics to monitor provider performance, identify emerging trends and risks, and inform continuous improvements to relationship management strategies.
	Develop and implement a strategy to measure and improve the Reliance Health member experience while seeking care at providers on the Reliance Health network across all markets.
	Develop and implement incentives for providers to minimize wait and maximize medical quality for Reliance Health members.
	Collaborate closely with Claims, Tariffs, and Case Management teams to ensure provider-facing processes are aligned, responsive, and support efficient claims processing, cost control, and high-quality care delivery.
	Lead and manage the provider acquisition and relationship management team to drive high performance across assigned portfolios, using data to track and improve clinical quality, member satisfaction, and adherence to Reliance Health processes and standards across all markets.
	Ensure timely and effective resolution of internal and external escalations related to provider issues, leveraging root cause analysis to prevent recurrence and improve provider touchpoints.
	Strengthen provider onboarding and engagement processes to build consistent alignment with operational expectations, reducing instances of long wait times, denied care, and poor member experiences.
	Use performance dashboards and data insights to set clear targets, monitor outcomes, and continuously coach the team to optimize provider compliance, responsiveness, and patient-centered service delivery.


Requirements


	At least 7 years of experience in healthcare operations, provider network management, or a related field.
	Proven track record of leading multi-market operations or managing stakeholders across multiple African countries.
	Experience in building and scaling systems, tools, or teams in a process-oriented environment.
	Strong understanding of the Nigerian healthcare landscape, with relevant contacts or working experience.
	Experience working in or with private healthcare providers, HMOs, or health tech companies is a strong plus.
	Strong negotiation and relationship management skills, especially with healthcare providers or partners.
	Candidate must be based in Nigeria; the role is remote within Nigeria.


Benefits
At Reliance Health, we prioritize our people and their well-being. Our benefits package is designed to support your success, growth, and happiness. Here’s what you’ll enjoy:


	Remote-First Environment: Work from anywhere while staying connected to a vibrant, collaborative team.
	Competitive Salary and Benefits: We offer a salary that’s benchmarked against the best in the industry, ensuring your expertise and impact are fully rewarded.
	Premium Health Insurance: Comprehensive health coverage for you and your family, because your well-being comes first.
	Unlimited Leave: Take the time you need when you need it—no limits, no questions.
	Meaningful Impact: Play a key role in transforming customer experiences and shaping healthcare innovation.
	Collaborative Work Culture: Join a supportive, inclusive, and team-focused environment that celebrates diversity.
	Growth Opportunities: Access tools, mentorship, and resources to elevate your skills and career.
	Learning & Development Allowance: We provide an allowance to support your ongoing professional growth and skill enhancement.

title: Content Creator (Social Media Manager) Job at Future Moves Recruitment Agency Limited
content:
Future Moves Recruitment Agency Limited (FMR Agency) - Our client, a Real Estate company, is recruiting a well experienced and competent candidate to fill the position below:

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Creator (Social Media Manager)

Job Location: Bodija, Ibadan Oyo,
Employment Type: Full-Time (Hybrid, 4 days onsite, 2 days remote per week)
Job Sector: Gadgets & Electronics

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are seeking a creative and organized Content Creator / Social Media Manager / Sales Recorder to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will manage social media platforms, create engaging content, and maintain accurate sales records.
	This hybrid role bridges both online engagement and offline sales operations, requiring someone proactive, trustworthy, and skilled at balancing multiple tasks.


Key Responsibilities


	Create engaging photo, video, and written content for the company’s social media platforms.
	Manage social media accounts, respond to messages, and engage with followers to grow the brand.
	Handle customer inquiries related to posted content and provide accurate product information. 
	Assist customers online and via phone, ensuring timely responses to their questions.
	Record daily sales transactions accurately using a computer.
	Work closely with the sales executive to align physical sales with online engagement.
	Maintain transparent and accurate sales records to prevent errors or fraud.


Requirements


	Minimum of National Diploma (ND) or equivalent.
	2–3 years of experience in content creation, social media management, or sales/inventory recording.
	Strong knowledge of major social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, etc.).
	Ability to create content (photos, videos, graphics) that drives engagement.
	Good customer service and communication skills.
	Basic knowledge of sales/inventory software (advantageous).
	Organized, proactive, and trustworthy.
	Language: Fluent in English.


Compensation
N100,000 Monthly

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@fmragency.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Inspiration Life Community Church is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Social Media Manager

Job Location: Abuja

Job Summary


	The Church Office (Inspiration Life Community Church) is seeking a passionate and creative Social Media Manager to join our team.
	This role is key to strengthening our online presence, engaging our community, promoting church events, and ensuring that our digital platforms reflect the vision and mission of the ministry.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute monthly social media content calendars across Instagram, Facebook, WhatsApp, TikTok, Threads, and YouTube.
	Run paid social media ads to grow page reach and follower engagement.
	Create and edit engaging content (posts, reels, stories, event highlights) using Canva, CapCut, and other tools.
	Capture photos and videos of services, events, and special programs for digital storytelling.
	Serve as the digital voice of the church by responding to comments, DMs, and inquiries promptly.
	Support the promotion of church services, conferences, outreaches, and special events through creative online campaigns.
	Track, analyze, and report performance metrics with recommendations for growth.
	Stay up-to-date with trends in digital media and apply best practices to church platforms.
	Be actively involved in the life of the church, attending all church services, events, and special programs as part of media coverage and engagement responsibilities.


Must-Have Qualifications


	1&ndash;5 years of experience managing social media for a brand, church, or nonprofit.
	Proficiency in social media ads management and audience growth strategies.
	Strong skills in Canva, CapCut, and other editing applications (experience with templates, brand kits, and animations is an advantage).
	Familiarity with Instagram, TikTok, Threads, WhatsApp Business, and basic video editing.
	Excellent copywriting skills with a deep understanding of Nigerian culture, humor, and slang.
	Experience engaging diaspora or immigrant communities.


Skills:


	Photography or videography skills (phone or professional).
	Basic graphic design knowledge.
	Prior experience in real estate, Airbnbs, or housing-related social media is an added advantage.


Key Attributes:


	Creative and strategic thinker with initiative.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
	Commitment to ministry, teamwork, and church involvement.


Method of Application
